headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Good morning, and welcome to AutoNation's First Quarter 2015 Conference Call and Webcast. Leading our call today will be Mike Jackson, Chairman, CEO and President; Cheryl Scully, CFO; Bill Berman, COO; and Jon Ferrando, our EVP responsible for M&A.  Follo
componenttext:
Good morning, and welcome to AutoNation's First Quarter 2015 Conference Call and Webcast. Leading our call today will be Mike Jackson, Chairman, CEO and President; Cheryl Scully, CFO; Bill Berman, COO; and Jon Ferrando, our EVP responsible for M&A.  Following their remarks, we will open up the call for questions. Robert Quartaro and I will also be available by phone following the call to address any additional questions that you may have. 
Before we begin, let me read our brief statement regarding forward-looking comments. Certain statements and information on this call will constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Federal Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Such forward-looking statements involve risks, which may cause the actual results or performance to differ materially from such forward-looking statements. Additional discussions of factors that could cause actual results to differ materially are contained in our press release issued earlier today and our SEC filings, including our most recent annual report on Form 10-K and subsequent quarterly reports on Form 10-Q and current reports on Form 8-K. Certain non-GAAP financial measures as defined under SEC rules will be discussed on this call. Reconciliations are provided in our press release and on our website at investors.autonation.com. 
And now, I'll turn the call over to AutoNation's Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Mike Jackson.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Good morning, and thank you for joining us. Today, we reported record first quarter of earnings per share from consuming operations of $0.97, a 29% increase as compared to adjusted EPS from continuing operations of $0.75 for the same period in the prior y
componenttext:
Good morning, and thank you for joining us. Today, we reported record first quarter of earnings per share from consuming operations of $0.97, a 29% increase as compared to adjusted EPS from continuing operations of $0.75 for the same period in the prior year. This is our 18th consecutive quarter of double-digit year-over-year growth and EPS from continuing operation. 
First quarter 2015 revenue totaled $4.9 billion compared to $4.4 billion in the year-ago period, an increase of 13%, driven by stronger performance in all of our business sectors. 
In the first quarter, AutoNation's retail new vehicle unit sales increased 10% or 9% on same-store basis. 
AutoNation continue to report during this recovery with an optimal brand and market, mix and disciplined cost structure. We continue to drive solid results across all our business sectors. 
I'll now turn the call over to Chief Financial Officer, Cheryl Scully.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Mike, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. For the first quarter, we reported net income from continuing operations of $112 million or $0.97 per share versus adjusted net income of $91 million or $0.75 per share during the first quarter of 2
componenttext:
Thank you, Mike, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. For the first quarter, we reported net income from continuing operations of $112 million or $0.97 per share versus adjusted net income of $91 million or $0.75 per share during the first quarter of 2014, a 29% improvement on a per-share basis. There were no adjustments to net income in the first quarter of 2015.  Adjustments in net income in prior periods are included in the reconciliation provided in our press release. 
In the first quarter, revenue increased $581 million or 13% compared to the prior year and gross profit improved $93 million or 13%. SG&A as a percentage of gross profit was 69.7% for the quarter, which represents 110 basis-point decrease compared to the year-ago period. 
Net new vehicle floorplan was a benefit of $14.2 million, an increase of $2.9 million from the first quarter of 2014, primarily due to higher floorplan assistance which increased due to higher new vehicle sales. 
Floorplan debt decreased sequentially, approximately $95 million during the first quarter to $3 billion at quarter end, primarily due to decreased borrowings on our used vehicle floorplan facilities. 
Non-vehicle interest expense decreased slightly to $21.4 million compared to $21.6 million in the first quarter of 2014, primarily due to improved pricing from our credit facility refinancing that was completed in December of 2014. 
At the end of March, we had $1 billion of outstanding borrowings under the revolving credit facility and a total non-vehicle debt balance of $2.1 billion. This was a decrease of $73 million compared to December 31, 2014.  The provision for income tax in the quarter was $69.8 million or 38.5%. 
From January 1 through April 20, 2015, we repurchased 150,000 shares for $9 million at an average price of $60.46 per share. AutoNation has approximately $272 million of remaining Board authorization for share repurchase. 
As of April 20, there were approximately 114 million shares outstanding. This does not include the dilutive impact of stock options. 
Our leverage ratio decreased to 2.2x at the end of Q1 as compared to 2.3x at the end of Q4. The leverage ratio was 2.0x on a net debt basis and includes used floorplan availability and our covenant limit is 3.75x. 
Capital expenditures were $63 million for the quarter. Capital expenditures are on an accrual basis, excluding operating lease buyouts and related asset sales. 
Our quarter end cash balance was $74 million, which combined with our additional borrowing capacity, resulted in total liquidity of $900 million at the end of March. 
The finance team remains committed to supporting our operational partners with the unified focus on driving long-term shareholder value. 
Now let me turn you over to our Chief Operating Officer, Bill Berman.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Cheryl, and good morning. AutoNation posted stellar first quarter results with double-digit growth in revenue and gross profit across all business sectors. This marked our 18th consecutive quarter of double-digit EPS growth. Going forward, my
componenttext:
Thank you, Cheryl, and good morning. AutoNation posted stellar first quarter results with double-digit growth in revenue and gross profit across all business sectors. This marked our 18th consecutive quarter of double-digit EPS growth. 
Going forward, my comments will be on a same-store basis and compared to the tier a year ago unless noted otherwise. 
Total gross profit for variable operations was $459 million, up 12%. Total variable growth was $3,406 on a per vehicle retailed basis, an increase of $67 or 2%.  New same-store sales unit volume was up 10%. New vehicle revenue for the quarter was $2.7 billion, an increase of $277 million or 11%. 
We retailed 72,900 units, an increase of 9%. New vehicle gross profit was $2,005 on a per vehicle retail basis, off slightly due to continued pressure on Import segment, as well as growth in volume of entry-level Premium Luxury models. 
For the quarter, used vehicle retail revenue was $1.1 billion, an increase of $121 million or 13%. Used vehicle retail for $57,400, up 11%.  Used vehicle gross profit was $1,738 on a per vehicle retail basis, a decrease of $42 or 2%. 
As you might remember in Q1, 2014,  we focused on maximizing margin due to our tight inventory supply. We are well positioned with our used inventory for the second quarter. We increased our total store used unit by 26% compared to last year and our current total store used vehicle inventory levels at 34 days. 
Customer financial services gross profit had an all-time record at $1,515 on a per vehicle retail basis, an increase of $114 or 8%. 
Approximately 2/3 of our gross profit per vehicle retail was related to customer financial service products and approximately 1/3 was related to finance. 
Total gross profit per customer financial services of $203 million was up $32 million or 19% compared to the period a year ago. 
We continue to see opportunity in customer financial services as we guard store-level execution and offer products that build customer value and loyalty. 
In the quarter, customer care revenue was $723 million, an increase of $56 million or 8%. We've had an all-time record high in customer care growth profit of $310 million, an increase of $26 million or 9%. 
Customer pay gross was $124 million, up 4%. This was our 19th consecutive quarterly increase in customer pay gross. 
Warranty gross was $60 million, up 19%. Dilution growth was $29 million, up 11%. 
Excluding the impact of elevated recalls, we continue to expect mid-single digit growth in customer care. 
I would like to then call 24,500 associates for a job well done this quarter. As an organization, we remain focused on driving sales, driving service and building the AutoNation brand. 
I'll now turn the call over to Jon Ferrando.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Bill. We're excited to announce that in April, we completed 2 acquisitions that we signed in the first quarter, including Mercedes-Benz store located in San Jose, California. This represents our 22nd Mercedes-Benz franchise and our 21st franchi
componenttext:
Thank you, Bill. We're excited to announce that in April, we completed 2 acquisitions that we signed in the first quarter, including Mercedes-Benz store located in San Jose, California. This represents our 22nd Mercedes-Benz franchise and our 21st franchise in Northern California. 
We also acquired a Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram store in Valencia, California, our 32nd franchise in Southern California. The Chrysler store will be an excellent addition to our business in the Valencia Automall, where we offer 9 brands. 
AutoNation has also signed an agreement to acquire a Jaguar, Land Rover and Volvo store in our Spokane, Washington market. This will give us 25 franchises in the State of Washington. 
As previously announced, during the quarter, we completed the acquisition of Mercedes-Benz store in Reno, Nevada and the Volkswagen store in Atlanta. The combined annual revenue for our 5 acquisitions since the beginning of 2015, including the Spokane acquisition, which we expect to complete in early May is approximately $320 million. 
As of today, our store portfolio number is 290 franchises and 235 stores in 15 states, representing 34 manufacturer brands. 
Looking forward, we will continue to actively pursue acquisitions and new store opportunities with a focus on enhancing brand representation within our author retail markets, as well as markets that can be supported by our existing management infrastructure. 
As for M&A market conditions, there is a solid pipeline of potential opportunities in the marketplace. While we have not seen a material increase in competition for deals, we have seen an uptick in sellers testing the market with unrealistic expectations. 
We will continue to be selective and prudent with our capital with a focus on investing to produce strong returns and long-term shareholder value. 
I will now turn it back to Mike Jackson.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jon. We believe the auto industry is healthy. We still expect the industry new vehicle sales to be above 17 million units. And with that, we will take your questions.
componenttext:
Thanks, Jon. We believe the auto industry is healthy. We still expect the industry new vehicle sales to be above 17 million units. 
And with that, we will take your questions.

componenttextpreview: One question I wanted to have just you have this Chrysler news that came out where they were talking about raising the, I guess, invoice prices on their dealers and I guess, without raising MSRP, and I wanted to get your view on whether, A, that was being
componenttext: One question I wanted to have just you have this Chrysler news that came out where they were talking about raising the, I guess, invoice prices on their dealers and I guess, without raising MSRP, and I wanted to get your view on whether, A, that was being accurately portrayed; and B, whether that even matters. Because I feel like you guys set your own prices and potentially if the vehicles are as hot as they are, maybe there's an availability to really offset the increased list price. So just some thoughts on that.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Mrs. Mike Jackson. I believe the reporting is accurate. But I'm more in your B that you got to look at the totality of relationship the fact of the matter is Chrysler business is moving, we have a high throughput in our stores. It's been a phenomenal reco
componenttext: Mrs. Mike Jackson. I believe the reporting is accurate. But I'm more in your B that you got to look at the totality of relationship the fact of the matter is Chrysler business is moving, we have a high throughput in our stores. It's been a phenomenal recovery led by Sergio and his entire team and the stores are very profitable with profitability growing. So how they run their marketing scheme in the various things, it's a partnership with them. And in principal, some it's a win-win relationship, and we certainly believe with Chrysler, it is, the details are not so much of a concern.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay, that's helpful. And maybe I can squeeze in an obligatory CFPB question. I suppose we're on the cusp of getting the new rules published where they officially take over in a regulation and nonbank financials. There's been, obviously, a lot of talk wit
componenttext: Okay, that's helpful. And maybe I can squeeze in an obligatory CFPB question. I suppose we're on the cusp of getting the new rules published where they officially take over in a regulation and nonbank financials. There's been, obviously, a lot of talk within CFPB documentation about markups and some have speculated that they may try to convince the industry participants to go after sort of a flat fee, a number of numbers haven't thrown out, but, I mean, this is just discussion. Wanted to just see where you guys were coming out on that and what you thought -- how you thought this might end up.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Again, this is Mike Jackson. Our portfolio has been tested 18,000x. That's not exaggeration, 18,000x and a very miniscule nominal number of situations were recalled to be looked at, and we look at the detail, there's not much of there. So I could certainl
componenttext: Again, this is Mike Jackson. Our portfolio has been tested 18,000x. That's not exaggeration, 18,000x and a very miniscule nominal number of situations were recalled to be looked at, and we look at the detail, there's not much of there. So I could certainly speak for our portfolio that there's no sign of disparate impact, let alone discrimination. As far as the CFPB is positioned for flat, that's been their position from Day 1. And so far the banking industry that's not where they want to go because the system in principle is working very effectively for all the constituents. It's working for the consumers, it's working for all the protected classes, it's working for the banks, and it's working for the retailers. So it's a very efficient, effective system. So what's probably going to happen, I don't know. But I don't sense anything in pending that's going to turn the world upside down.

componenttext: So what we're seeing out there, this is Bill again. componenttextpreview: In Express, our journey to improve our AutoNation digital performance really began with the launching of the brand AutoNation just over 2 years ago. And I recall at the time, I said that was the inflection point. It's our investment in the brand in digita
componenttext: In Express, our journey to improve our AutoNation digital performance really began with the launching of the brand AutoNation just over 2 years ago. And I recall at the time, I said that was the inflection point. It's our investment in the brand in digital is progressing extremely well. And if I look at our business here in the first quarter, fully 19% of it was generated by the AutoNation sites, and we had about 13% of our total business come from third-party sites. So we significantly outgrown, had across over as far as dependence upon third-party sites. As far as transactional capability under the flag, AutoNation Express, it's now active in 84 of our stores. It's been very well accepted by our customers and by the stores. We will roll it out across the rest of the enterprise through the course of the year. And I expect in the next several years this strength of the AutoNation digital sites versus third-party will widen with our sites breaking over 20 and third-party sites going down into high single digits over the next couple of years.

componenttext: So our used vehicle volume, as I said, was up significantly. We're looking at our used car gross profit was up 7.9%. The nice thing about the used car business is with the availability of inventory increasing and the way the market ebbs and flows, as the flops, we're able to buy our cars for lower money. And because the market dynamics, being able to drive and sustain PVR. So we really don't see any negative impact going forward.

componenttextpreview: This is a Irina Hodakovsky on for Brett Hoselton. A question for your regarding acquisitions and the comments you made about market activity. Is it reasonable to assume that going forward, given the increased number of sellers in the market, perhaps your
componenttext: This is a Irina Hodakovsky on for Brett Hoselton. A question for your regarding acquisitions and the comments you made about market activity. Is it reasonable to assume that going forward, given the increased number of sellers in the market, perhaps your capital deployment will be weighted a little more towards acquisition than stock repurchases?

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes, this is Mike Jackson. Going forward, on capital allocation, it's never given that much clarity other than to say we're always looking at the balance between the opportunity on the acquisition side and the opportunity that's available on the share rep
componenttext: Yes, this is Mike Jackson. Going forward, on capital allocation, it's never given that much clarity other than to say we're always looking at the balance between the opportunity on the acquisition side and the opportunity that's available on the share repurchase side. I think it's fair to say that we have a lot of discussion underway, but you'd never really know whether that needs the transaction are not. So it's very dangerous to say we're going to do x in this quarter in that quarter because then you feel this pressure to conclude deals to meet commitments that you made. That I think it is fair to say that there is a lot of activity and a lot of discussion underway from willing sellers, and we'll see if that leads to transactions

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Just a couple of questions here, thinking about some of your -- just the recall that you made before. What's the sense of where you are in some of the largest companies that are out there? And I guess, the add-on to that is the sense that we are in an ele
componenttext: Just a couple of questions here, thinking about some of your -- just the recall that you made before. What's the sense of where you are in some of the largest companies that are out there? And I guess, the add-on to that is the sense that we are in an elevated recall world for the foreseeable future.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay, this is Bill. So the 2 biggest recall that we have right now is the GM ignition switch. We performed approximately 23,000 recall there, it's about 60% of what we feel is available to our current customer base. And to cut an airbag, we've done 48,000
componenttext: Okay, this is Bill. So the 2 biggest recall that we have right now is the GM ignition switch. We performed approximately 23,000 recall there, it's about 60% of what we feel is available to our current customer base. And to cut an airbag, we've done 48,000, which is approximately 20%. The availability on the parts for the cicada airbag is starting to open up, we saw small increase on that but overall that's where our 2 biggest.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: All right, I appreciate that. Just the thought for the next 3 to 5 years may in the perpetuity, we're looking at a situation where recall activity is just going to be elevated?
componenttext: All right, I appreciate that. Just the thought for the next 3 to 5 years may in the perpetuity, we're looking at a situation where recall activity is just going to be elevated?

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes, I think it will be probably a little higher. But whether it's this high, I'm not convinced at all. These are 2 extraordinary recalls that are so broad, and so old that to say we're going to have these type of recalls open-ended, I'm not necessarily t
componenttext: Yes, I think it will be probably a little higher. But whether it's this high, I'm not convinced at all. These are 2 extraordinary recalls that are so broad, and so old that to say we're going to have these type of recalls open-ended, I'm not necessarily there. But I think the feeling within the industry is in doubt. Recall, the sooner the better. And certainly, the whole process somehow someway needs to be improved. It's really broken the way it is today, almost dysfunctional. We get it all done at the end of the day, but it's certainly not ideal, and it's certainly customers deserve something better than what's going on today. But to say we're going to be open-ended at this level, would not necessarily agree with that.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then just my last one. Used vehicle pricing, I may have missed it, average selling price continues to rise. How much of that is mix going from car and cross over to full-sized SUV versus just like-for-like, what you're seeing from pricing standp
componenttext: Okay. And then just my last one. Used vehicle pricing, I may have missed it, average selling price continues to rise. How much of that is mix going from car and cross over to full-sized SUV versus just like-for-like, what you're seeing from pricing standpoint end of use?

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: We have to get back to give you breakdown trucks, versus SUV used cars. I mean, inherently, as the volumes decrease on the new car side, the corresponding years in the late model 2 to 4-year-old cars, inherently, the prices go up. So most of it is being d
componenttext: We have to get back to give you breakdown trucks, versus SUV used cars. I mean, inherently, as the volumes decrease on the new car side, the corresponding years in the late model 2 to 4-year-old cars, inherently, the prices go up. So most of it is being driven by the mix of inventory that's available in the marketplace.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: And the next one is Mr. David Lim of Wells Fargo.
componenttext: And the next one is Mr. David Lim of Wells Fargo.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: A question for either Mike, Cheryl or Bill, when we think about the F&I, PVR and I think you mentioned earlier 1/3 of it is from the finance side, in a scenario where the CFPB does mandate a fixed fee of, let's say, $250 or $300, whatever it is. And you g
componenttext: A question for either Mike, Cheryl or Bill, when we think about the F&I, PVR and I think you mentioned earlier 1/3 of it is from the finance side, in a scenario where the CFPB does mandate a fixed fee of, let's say, $250 or $300, whatever it is. And you guys lose $100 to $200 per vehicle, what are the levels that you could pull in order to make up the $100 to $200 lost there, in theory? And then I do have a second follow-up question.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: This is Mike Jackson. So first, I'd be surprised if the industry moved to a flat fee. And if they've be moved a flat fee, I'm surprised of what that is the flat fee is the number that you mentioned. Doesn't mean I can't be surprised, so I'm just saying th
componenttext: This is Mike Jackson. So first, I'd be surprised if the industry moved to a flat fee. And if they've be moved a flat fee, I'm surprised of what that is the flat fee is the number that you mentioned. Doesn't mean I can't be surprised, so I'm just saying that's not where I think this is going. Let's see. I stated the case well. We see exception of product set on a portfolio. And speaking of flatness, our finance side of the equation has been relatively flat for years. All the growth has been on the product side, and we intend to take a big step launching a pilot in the third quarter where, again, with the brand AutoNation, we will now offer our own service and maintenance contract and this would be AutoNation branding. And we feel this will be another growth opportunity that has the potential to be very beneficial in 2016 as we get through the pilot phase.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Interesting. And I know that some of these OEMs further down the road are talking about over the air software updates, whether it be infotainment or what have you for their vehicles. How would that affect your business or the dealer business, in general?
componenttext: Interesting. And I know that some of these OEMs further down the road are talking about over the air software updates, whether it be infotainment or what have you for their vehicles. How would that affect your business or the dealer business, in general? And is that something where you guys are maybe or dealers, in general, pushing back on the OEMs? Or proposing that these software updates actually occur, should occur at the dealership?

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: First, now, we're quite the opposite. We advocating whatever is most convenient for the customer and have long argued that the cars be designed and equipped in a way that these software updates can be done on a regular basis without any inconvenience to t
componenttext: First, now, we're quite the opposite. We advocating whatever is most convenient for the customer and have long argued that the cars be designed and equipped in a way that these software updates can be done on a regular basis without any inconvenience to the customers. And I think that's pretty much the direction the industry is going on. I think some manufacturers uncertain model are already there, and I expect that to be continued in the future. It's not a big part of our business today.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: This is Bill. I think I would add to that is on the flip side of it, I think technology is also going to be also drive the customer to be able to diagnose the car and drive the customer back into the dealer to perform whether it's a maintenance requiremen
componenttext: This is Bill. I think I would add to that is on the flip side of it, I think technology is also going to be also drive the customer to be able to diagnose the car and drive the customer back into the dealer to perform whether it's a maintenance requirement or a possible warranty our recall. We could notify the dealer and the customer as well as come back into us. So we see it as a positive.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes, that's the other thing we're pushing forward with the manufacturers that the car communicate with us what its maintenance needs are so that when customer comes in, we already know we need this and this and the parts have been ordered and they're ther
componenttext: Yes, that's the other thing we're pushing forward with the manufacturers that the car communicate with us what its maintenance needs are so that when customer comes in, we already know we need this and this and the parts have been ordered and they're there, we're ready to make repairs. So I think there's connected car where the car, I'm talking to the manufacturer and talking to the customer care experts namely as the retailer. I think there's tremendous potential for the business and for the convenience of the customer, and we're all for it.

Welcome to AutoNation's First Quarter 2015 Earnings Conference Call. [Operator Instructions] Today's conference is being recorded. If you have an objection, you may disconnect at this time.
Now I will turn the call over to Andrew Wamser, Treasurer and Vice President of Investor Relations for AutoNation.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Good morning, and welcome to AutoNation's First Quarter 2015 Conference Call and Webcast. Leading our call today will be Mike Jackson, Chairman, CEO and President; Cheryl Scully, CFO; Bill Berman, COO; and Jon Ferrando, EVP responsible for M&A.  Following
componenttext:
Good morning, and welcome to AutoNation's First Quarter 2015 Conference Call and Webcast. Leading our call today will be Mike Jackson, Chairman, CEO and President; Cheryl Scully, CFO; Bill Berman, COO; and Jon Ferrando, EVP responsible for M&A.  Following their remarks, we will open up the call for questions. Robert Quartaro and I will also be available by phone following the call to address any additional questions that you may have.
Before we begin, let me read our brief statement regarding forward-looking comments. Certain statements and information on this call may constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Federal Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Such forward-looking statements involve risks, which may cause the actual results or performance to differ materially from such forward-looking statements. Additional discussions of factors that could cause actual results to differ materially are contained in our press release issued earlier today and our SEC filings, including our most recent annual report on Form 10-K and subsequent quarterly reports on Form 10-Q and current reports on Form 8-K. Certain non-GAAP financial measures as defined under SEC rules will be discussed on this call. Reconciliations are provided in our press release and on our website located at investors.autonation.com.
And now I will turn the call over to AutoNation's Chairman, CEO and President, Mike Jackson.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Good morning, and thank you for joining us. Today, we reported record first quarter earnings per share from consuming operations of $0.97, a 29% increase as compared to adjusted EPS from continuing operations of $0.75 for the same period in the prior year
componenttext:
Good morning, and thank you for joining us. Today, we reported record first quarter earnings per share from consuming operations of $0.97, a 29% increase as compared to adjusted EPS from continuing operations of $0.75 for the same period in the prior year. This is our 18th consecutive quarter of double-digit year-over-year growth in EPS from continuing operations.
First quarter 2015 revenue totaled $4.9 billion compared to $4.4 billion in the year ago period, an increase of 13%, driven by a stronger performance in all of our business sectors.
In the first quarter, AutoNation's retail new vehicle unit sales increased 10% or 9% on same-store basis.
AutoNation continued reforms during this recovery with an optimal brand and market mix and a disciplined cost structure. We continue to drive solid results across all our business sectors.
I'll now turn the call over to Chief Financial Officer, Cheryl Scully.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Mike, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. For the first quarter, we reported net income from continuing operations of $112 million or $0.97 per share versus adjusted net income of $91 million or $0.75 per share during the first quarter of 2
componenttext:
Thank you, Mike, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. For the first quarter, we reported net income from continuing operations of $112 million or $0.97 per share versus adjusted net income of $91 million or $0.75 per share during the first quarter of 2014, a 29% improvement on a per-share basis. There were no adjustments to net income in the first quarter of 2015. Adjustments in net income in prior periods are included in the reconciliations provided in our press release.
In the first quarter, revenue increased $581 million or 13% compared to the prior year, and gross profit improved $93 million or 13%. SG&A as a percentage of gross profit was 69.7% for the quarter, which represents 110 basis point decrease compared to the year ago period.
Net new vehicle floorplan was a benefit of $14.2 million, an increase of $2.9 million from the first quarter of 2014, primarily due to higher floorplan assistance, which increased due to higher new vehicle sales.
Floorplan debt decreased sequentially, approximately $95 million, during the first quarter to $3 billion at quarter end, primarily due to increased -- decreased borrowings on our used vehicle floorplan facilities.
Nonvehicle interest expense decreased slightly to $21.4 million compared to $21.6 million in the first quarter of 2014, primarily due to improved pricing from our credit facility refinancing that was completed in December of 2014. At the end of March, we had $1 billion of outstanding borrowings under the revolving credit facility and a total nonvehicle debt balance of $2.1 billion. This was a decrease of $73 million compared to December 31, 2014. The provision for income tax in the quarter was $69.8 million or 38.5%.
From January 1 through April 20, 2015, we repurchased 150,000 shares for $9 million at an average price of $60.46 per share. AutoNation has approximately $272 million of remaining board authorization for share repurchase. As of April 20, there were approximately 114 million shares outstanding. This does not include the dilutive impact of stock options.
Our leverage ratio decreased to 2.2x at the end of Q1 as compared to 2.3x at the end of Q4. The leverage ratio was 2.0x on a net-debt basis, and this includes used floorplan availability. And our covenant limit is 3.75x.
Capital expenditures were $63 million for the quarter. Capital expenditures are on an accrual basis, excluding operating lease buyouts and related asset sales.
Our quarter-end cash balance was $74 million, which, combined with our additional borrowing capacity, resulted in total liquidity of $900 million at the end of March.
The finance team remains committed to supporting our operational partners with a unified focus on driving long-term shareholder value.
Now let me turn you over to our Chief Operating Officer, Bill Berman.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Cheryl, and good morning. AutoNation posted stellar first quarter results with double-digit growth in revenue and gross profit across all business sectors. This marked our 18th consecutive quarter of double-digit EPS growth. Going forward, my c
componenttext:
Thank you, Cheryl, and good morning. AutoNation posted stellar first quarter results with double-digit growth in revenue and gross profit across all business sectors. This marked our 18th consecutive quarter of double-digit EPS growth. Going forward, my comments will be on a same-store basis and compared to the period a year ago unless noted otherwise.
Total gross profit for variable operations was $459 million, up 12%. Total variable growth was $3,406 on a per vehicle retail basis, an increase of $67 or 2%. New and used same-store sale unit volume was up 10%. New vehicle revenue for the quarter was $2.7 billion, an increase of $277 million or 11%.
We retailed 76,900 units, an increase of 9%. New vehicle gross profit was $2,005 on a per vehicle retail basis, off slightly due to continued pressure in Import segment as well as growth in volume of entry-level Premium Luxury models.
For the quarter, used vehicle retail revenue was $1.1 billion, an increase of $121 million or 13%. Used vehicle retailed were 57,400, up 11%. Used vehicle gross profit was $1,738 on a per vehicle retail basis, a decrease of $42 or 2%.
As you might remember in Q1 2014, we focused on maximizing margins due to our tight inventory supply. We are well positioned with our used inventory for the second quarter. We increased our total store used units by 26% compared to last year and our current total store used vehicle inventory levels at 34 days.
Customer financial services gross profit set an all-time record at $1,515 on a per vehicle retail basis, an increase of $114 or 8%. Approximately 2/3 of our gross profit per vehicle retailed was related to customer financial service products, and approximately 1/3 was related to finance.
Total gross profit per customer financial services of $203 million was up $32 million or 19% compared to the period a year ago. We continue to see opportunity in customer financial services as we guard store-level execution and offer products that build customer value and loyalty.
In the quarter, customer care revenue was $723 million, an increase of $56 million or 8%. We've set an all-time record high in customer care gross profit of $310 million, an increase of $26 million or 9%.
Customer pay gross was $124 million, up 4%. This was our 19th consecutive quarterly increase in customer pay gross.
Warranty gross was $60 million, up 19%. Collision growth was $29 million, up 11%.
Excluding the impact of elevated recalls, we continue to expect mid-single-digit growth in customer care.
I would like to then call 24,500 associates for a job well done this quarter. As an organization, we remain focused on driving sales, driving service and building the AutoNation brand.
I'll now turn the call over to Jon Ferrando.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Bill. We are excited to announce that in April, we completed 2 acquisitions that we signed in the first quarter, including Mercedes-Benz store located in San Jose, California. This represents our 22nd Mercedes-Benz franchise and our 21st franch
componenttext:
Thank you, Bill. We are excited to announce that in April, we completed 2 acquisitions that we signed in the first quarter, including Mercedes-Benz store located in San Jose, California. This represents our 22nd Mercedes-Benz franchise and our 21st franchise in Northern California.
We also acquired a Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram store in Valencia, California, our 32nd franchise in Southern California. The Chrysler store will be an excellent addition to our business in the Valencia Auto Mall where we offer 9 brands.
AutoNation has also signed an agreement to acquire a Jaguar, Land Rover and Volvo store in our Spokane, Washington market. This will give us 25 franchises in the State of Washington.
As previously announced, during the quarter, we completed the acquisition of a Mercedes-Benz store in Reno, Nevada and a Volkswagen store in Atlanta. The combined annual revenue for our 5 acquisitions since the beginning of 2015, including the Spokane acquisition, which we expect to complete in early May, is approximately $320 million.
As of today, our store portfolio number is 290 franchises and 235 stores in 15 states, representing 34 manufacturer brands.
Looking forward, we will continue to actively pursue acquisitions and new store opportunities with a focus on enhancing brand representation within our author retail markets as well as markets that can be supported by our existing management infrastructure.
As for M&A market conditions, there is a solid pipeline of potential opportunities in the marketplace. While we have not seen a material increase in competition for deals, we have seen an uptick in sellers testing the market with unrealistic expectations.
We will continue to be selective and prudent with our capital with a focus on investing to produce strong returns and long-term shareholder value.
I will now turn it back to Mike Jackson.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jon. We believe the auto industry is healthy. We still expect the industry new vehicle sales to be above 17 million units.And with that, we will take your questions.
componenttext:
Thanks, Jon. We believe the auto industry is healthy. We still expect the industry new vehicle sales to be above 17 million units.
And with that, we will take your questions.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015

componenttext: [Operator Instructions] Our first question is from Mr. Patrick Archambault.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: One question I wanted to have -- to ask is just, you have this Chrysler news that came out where they were talking about raising the, I guess, invoice prices on their dealers and, I guess, without raising MSRP. And I wanted to get your view on whether, a,
componenttext: One question I wanted to have -- to ask is just, you have this Chrysler news that came out where they were talking about raising the, I guess, invoice prices on their dealers and, I guess, without raising MSRP. And I wanted to get your view on whether, a, that was being accurately portrayed; and b, whether that even matters. Because I feel like you guys kind of set your own prices, and potentially, if the vehicles are as hot as they are, maybe there's an ability to really offset the increased list price. So just some thoughts on that.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: This is Mike Jackson. I believe the reporting is accurate. But I'm more in your b that you have to look at the totality of the relationship. The fact of the matter is our Chrysler business is booming. We have high throughput through our stores. It's been
componenttext: This is Mike Jackson. I believe the reporting is accurate. But I'm more in your b that you have to look at the totality of the relationship. The fact of the matter is our Chrysler business is booming. We have high throughput through our stores. It's been a phenomenal recovery led by Sergio and his entire team, and the stores are very profitable with profitability growing. So how they run their marketing scheme in the various things, it's a partnership with them. And in principle, as long as it's a win-win relationship, and we certainly believe with Chrysler, it is, the details are not so much of a concern.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay, that's helpful. And maybe if I can squeeze in an obligatory CFPB question. I suppose we're on the cusp of getting the new rules published where they officially take over in a regulation and nonbank financials. There's been, obviously, a lot of talk
componenttext: Okay, that's helpful. And maybe if I can squeeze in an obligatory CFPB question. I suppose we're on the cusp of getting the new rules published where they officially take over in a regulation and nonbank financials. There's been, obviously, a lot of talk within CFPB documentation about markups, and some have speculated that they may try to convince the industry participants to go after sort of a flat fee. A number of numbers have been thrown out, but I mean, this is just discussion. Wanted to just see where you guys were coming out on that and what you thought -- how you thought this might end up.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Again, this is Mike Jackson. Our portfolio has been tested 18,000x. That's not exaggeration, 18,000x, and a very miniscule nominal number of situations were recalled to be looked at. And we look at them in detail, there's not much there. So I could certai
componenttext: Again, this is Mike Jackson. Our portfolio has been tested 18,000x. That's not exaggeration, 18,000x, and a very miniscule nominal number of situations were recalled to be looked at. And we look at them in detail, there's not much there. So I could certainly speak for our portfolio that there's no sign of disparate impact, let alone discrimination. As far as the CFP -- CFPB is positioned for flat. That's been their position from day 1. And so far, the banking industry had said that's not where they want to go because the system, in principle, is working very effectively for all the constituents. It's working for the consumers. It's working for all the protected classes. It's working for the banks, and it's working for the retailers. So it's a very efficient, effective system. So what's probably going to happen, I don't know. But I don't sense anything in pending that's going to turn the world upside down.

componenttext: So this is Bill Berman. And yes, we are definitely giving our revenue growth on -- out of Premium Luxury. That's just because of the average on price per point. The gross is definitely being generated out of the Domestic segment, and that's primarily driven by increased light-duty truck sales, trucks and SUVs.

componenttextpreview: So what we're seeing out there -- this is Bill again. What we're seeing on our PVRs is -- are -- we're extremely [ph] pleased with our performance in our total overall variable up PVR, which is up 3.2%. What we're seeing is, once again, steady growth in o
componenttext: So what we're seeing out there -- this is Bill again. What we're seeing on our PVRs is -- are -- we're extremely [ph] pleased with our performance in our total overall variable up PVR, which is up 3.2%. What we're seeing is, once again, steady growth in our Domestic or downward pressures on our Import. And our Premium Luxuries are holding, but the average sale price on our Premium Luxury is because they're entry-level models that have been recently introduced is breaking down our margins and reducing our gross slightly. But all in all, like I said, we're extremely [ph] pleased with our performance, and our total variable up PVR has increased 3.2%.

componenttext: AutoNation has always been a leader in CFS with our technology and our training and look to continue be that way. We see steady growth opportunities in our CFS performance, especially in our lower-performing quartile stores. And as we increase our focus on our product sales, we'll continue to grow our CFS PVRs.

componenttext: I think as far as our increase, it's around 25% of the gross profit increase. So of our gross profit customer care increase in the first quarter, 25% of it was recall related, so that's -- so at the peak of this surge of recall. That's all -- that's what it meant to us.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: First one on the Express stores, it's early days, but now you have about 120 days of operations under your belt. Can you give us any color on transaction times and market share performance of the stores there? And if you could highlight a few things that
componenttext: First one on the Express stores, it's early days, but now you have about 120 days of operations under your belt. Can you give us any color on transaction times and market share performance of the stores there? And if you could highlight a few things that may have surprise even you at.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. In Express, our journey to improve our AutoNation digital performance really began with the launching of the brand AutoNation just over 2 years ago. And I recall at the time, I said that was the inflection point. And so our investment in the brand in
componenttext: Yes. In Express, our journey to improve our AutoNation digital performance really began with the launching of the brand AutoNation just over 2 years ago. And I recall at the time, I said that was the inflection point. And so our investment in the brand in digital is progressing extremely well. And if I look at our business here in the first quarter, fully 19% of it was generated by the AutoNation sites, and we had about 13% of our total business come from third-party sites. So we've significantly outgrown and had a crossover as far as our dependence upon third-party sites. As far as this transactional capability under the flag AutoNation Express, it's now active in 84 of our stores. It's been very well accepted by our customers and by the stores. We will roll it out across the rest of the enterprise through the course of the year. And I expect, in the next several years, this strength of the AutoNation digital sites versus third-party will widen with our sites breaking over 20 and third-party sites going down into high single digits over the next couple of years.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: That's helpful. And just a second one on the used business here. You obviously had a great volume quarter then. Sizing continues to be very favorable. But what we continue to see, and this is across the dealer go back to the impact, demand and pricing isn
componenttext: That's helpful. And just a second one on the used business here. You obviously had a great volume quarter then. Sizing continues to be very favorable. But what we continue to see, and this is across the dealer go back to the impact, demand and pricing isn't really helping keep GPUs up. If you could help us understand why that is the case.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: So our used vehicle volume, as you said, was up significantly. We're looking at our total used car gross profit was up 7.9%. The nice thing about the used car business is with the availability of inventory increasing and the way the market ebbs and flows,
componenttext: So our used vehicle volume, as you said, was up significantly. We're looking at our total used car gross profit was up 7.9%. The nice thing about the used car business is with the availability of inventory increasing and the way the market ebbs and flows, as the market flops, we're able to buy our cars for lower money. And because the market dynamics being able to drive and sustain PVR. So we really don't see any negative impact going forward.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015

componenttext: Quick question, if I may. I noticed there are some of your press releases during the quarter, some of the state-of-the-art facility upgrades. Just wanted to understand kind of better what's going on there. And if you could put, at least, map around the high level as it relates to investment and return on that investment. And should we plan to see more of those still be upgrades rollout across the portfolio over time and on what date?

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. This is Mike Jackson. As I've often stated, our first responsibility is to our existing organic business, that it is state-of-the-art. In the first quarter, we had a number of major expenses in renovation that were of a level that have substantiated
componenttext: Yes. This is Mike Jackson. As I've often stated, our first responsibility is to our existing organic business, that it is state-of-the-art. In the first quarter, we had a number of major expenses in renovation that were of a level that have substantiated a re-grand opening that we did event in those markets. I hosted events in those markets with our associates and customers, and we did allow the local market press there for the press release. Yes, I think you're going to see that continued through the course of the year that our confidence and optimism about our existing footprint remains. We're committed to our OEM partners that had first-class facility. And when they arrive to a certain level of investment, we'll be doing events in those markets, and then you'll see a press release.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: This is a Irina Hodakovsky, on for Brett Hoselton.  I had a question for your regarding acquisitions and the comments you made about market activity. Is it reasonable to assume that going forward, given the increased number of sellers in the market, perha
componenttext: This is a Irina Hodakovsky, on for Brett Hoselton.  I had a question for your regarding acquisitions and the comments you made about market activity. Is it reasonable to assume that going forward, given the increased number of sellers in the market, perhaps, your capital deployment will be weighed a little more towards acquisitions than stock repurchases?

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes, this is Mike Jackson. Going forward, on capital allocation, we've never given that much clarity other than to say we're always looking at the balance between the opportunity on the acquisition side and the opportunity that's available on the share re
componenttext: Yes, this is Mike Jackson. Going forward, on capital allocation, we've never given that much clarity other than to say we're always looking at the balance between the opportunity on the acquisition side and the opportunity that's available on the share repurchase side. I think it's fair to say that we have a lot of discussions underway, but you'd never really know whether that needs the transactions are not. So it's very dangerous to say, "Oh, we're going to do x in this quarter, in that quarter," because then you feel this pressure to conclude deals to meet the commitments that you made. But I think it is fair to say that there is a lot of activity and a lot of discussion underway from willing sellers, and we'll see if that leads to transactions.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015

componenttext: Our next question is Brian Sponheimer of Gabelli.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Just a couple of questions here, thinking about some of your -- just the recall comment that you made before. What's your sense of where you are in some of the largest campaigns that are out there? And I guess, the add-on to that is the transaction [ph],
componenttext: Just a couple of questions here, thinking about some of your -- just the recall comment that you made before. What's your sense of where you are in some of the largest campaigns that are out there? And I guess, the add-on to that is the transaction [ph], the sense that we are in an elevated recall world for the foreseeable future.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay, so the 2 biggest -- this is Bill. The 2 biggest recalls that we have out there right now is the GM ignition switch. We've performed approximately 23,000 recalls there. It's about 60% of what we feel is available to our current customer base. And on
componenttext: Okay, so the 2 biggest -- this is Bill. The 2 biggest recalls that we have out there right now is the GM ignition switch. We've performed approximately 23,000 recalls there. It's about 60% of what we feel is available to our current customer base. And on the Takata airbag, we've done 48,000, which is approximately 20%. The availability on the parts for the Takata airbag are starting to open up, so we see -- yes, we had small increase in that. But overall, that's where out on 2 biggest.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: All right, I appreciate that. And just the thought that for the next 3 to 5 years and maybe in the perpetuity, we're just -- we're looking at a situation where recall activity is just going to be elevated.
componenttext: All right, I appreciate that. And just the thought that for the next 3 to 5 years and maybe in the perpetuity, we're just -- we're looking at a situation where recall activity is just going to be elevated.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. I think it'll be -- it probably will be higher. But whether it's this high, I'm not convinced at all. These are 2 extraordinary recalls that are so broad and so old that to say we're going to have these type of recalls open-ended, I'm not necessarily
componenttext: Yes. I think it'll be -- it probably will be higher. But whether it's this high, I'm not convinced at all. These are 2 extraordinary recalls that are so broad and so old that to say we're going to have these type of recalls open-ended, I'm not necessarily there. But I think the feeling within the industry is, if in doubt, recall, sooner the better. And certainly, this -- the whole process somehow, someway needs to be improved. It's really broken. The way it is today, almost disfunctional. We get it all done at the end of the day, but it's certainly not ideal. And certainly, the customers deserve something better than what's going on today. But to say we're going to be open-ended at this level, I would not necessarily agree with that.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then just my last one. Used vehicle pricing, I may have missed it, average selling prices continue to rise. How much of that is mix going from car and cross over to full-sized SUV versus just like-for-like what you're seeing from a pricing stand
componenttext: Okay. And then just my last one. Used vehicle pricing, I may have missed it, average selling prices continue to rise. How much of that is mix going from car and cross over to full-sized SUV versus just like-for-like what you're seeing from a pricing standpoint on used?

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: We have to get back, so you can get the breakdown on what's -- trucks, versus SUV versus used cars. Inherently, as the volumes decrease on the new car side, the corresponding years on the late model 2- to 4-year-old cars, inherently, the prices go up. So
componenttext: We have to get back, so you can get the breakdown on what's -- trucks, versus SUV versus used cars. Inherently, as the volumes decrease on the new car side, the corresponding years on the late model 2- to 4-year-old cars, inherently, the prices go up. So most of it is being driven by the mix of inventory that's available in the marketplace.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: And the next one is Mr. David Lim of Wells Fargo.
componenttext: And the next one is Mr. David Lim of Wells Fargo.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Question for either Mike, Cheryl or Bill, when we think about the F&I PVR, and I think you mentioned earlier 1/3 of it is from the finance side, in a scenario where the CFPB does mandate a fixed fee of, let's say, $250 or $300, whatever it is, and you guy
componenttext: Question for either Mike, Cheryl or Bill, when we think about the F&I PVR, and I think you mentioned earlier 1/3 of it is from the finance side, in a scenario where the CFPB does mandate a fixed fee of, let's say, $250 or $300, whatever it is, and you guys lose $100 to $200 per vehicle. What are the levers that you could pull in order to make up the $100 to $200 loss there, in theory? And then I do have a second follow-up question.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: This is Mike Jackson. So first, I'd be surprised if the industry moved to a flat fee. And if they did move to a flat fee, I'd be surprised if that is what the flat fee is, the number that you mentioned. Doesn't mean I can't be surprised, so I'm just sayin
componenttext: This is Mike Jackson. So first, I'd be surprised if the industry moved to a flat fee. And if they did move to a flat fee, I'd be surprised if that is what the flat fee is, the number that you mentioned. Doesn't mean I can't be surprised, so I'm just saying that's not where I think this is going, but let's see. I think Bill stated the case well. We've -- we see exceptional potential in the product side of the portfolio. And speaking of flatness, our finance side of the equation has been relatively flat for years. All the growth has been on the product side. And we intend to take a big step launching a pilot in the third quarter where, again, with the brand AutoNation, we will now offer our own service and maintenance contracts under the AutoNation brand name. And we feel this will be another growth opportunity that has the potential to be very beneficial in 2016 after we get through the pilot phase.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Interesting. And then I know that some of these OEMs, further down the road, are talking about over-the-air software updates, whether it'd be infotainment or what have you for their vehicles. How would that affect your business or the dealer business, in
componenttext: Interesting. And then I know that some of these OEMs, further down the road, are talking about over-the-air software updates, whether it'd be infotainment or what have you for their vehicles. How would that affect your business or the dealer business, in general? And is that something where you guys are maybe or dealers, in general, pushing back on the OEMs or proposing that these software updates actually occur, should occur at the dealership?

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: First, now, we're quite the opposite. We -- we're advocating whatever is most convenient for the customer and have long argued that the cars be designed and equipped in a way that these software updates can be done on a regular basis without any inconveni
componenttext: First, now, we're quite the opposite. We -- we're advocating whatever is most convenient for the customer and have long argued that the cars be designed and equipped in a way that these software updates can be done on a regular basis without any inconvenience to the customers. And I think that's pretty much the direction the industry is going in. I think some manufacturers on certain models are already there, and I expect that would -- to be continued in the future. It's not a big part of our business today.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: One thing -- this is Bill. I think I would add to that is, on the flip side of it, I think technology is also going to be able to drive the customer to be able to diagnose the car and drive the customer back into the dealer to perform whether it's a maint
componenttext: One thing -- this is Bill. I think I would add to that is, on the flip side of it, I think technology is also going to be able to drive the customer to be able to diagnose the car and drive the customer back into the dealer to perform whether it's a maintenance requirement or a possible warranty our a recall. And it could notify the dealer and the customer as well to come back into us. So we see it as a positive.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Yes. That's the other thing we're pushing forward with the manufacturers, that the car communicate with us what its maintenance needs are, so that when a customer comes in, we already know we need this, this and this and the parts have been ordered, and t
componenttext: Yes. That's the other thing we're pushing forward with the manufacturers, that the car communicate with us what its maintenance needs are, so that when a customer comes in, we already know we need this, this and this and the parts have been ordered, and they're there, we're ready to make the repairs. So I think this connected car where the car, I'm talking to the manufacturer and talking to the customer care experts namely as the retailer, I think has tremendous potential for the business and for the convenience of the customer, and we're all for it.

componenttext:
Welcome to AutoNation's First Quarter 2015 Earnings Conference Call. [Operator Instructions] Today's conference is being recorded. If you have an objection, you may disconnect at this time.
Now I will turn the call over to Andrew Wamser, Treasurer and Vice President of Investor Relations for AutoNation.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Good morning, and welcome to AutoNation's First Quarter 2015 Conference Call and Webcast. Leading our call today will be Mike Jackson, Chairman, CEO and President; Cheryl Scully, CFO; Bill Berman, COO; and Jon Ferrando, EVP responsible for M&A.  Following
componenttext:
Good morning, and welcome to AutoNation's First Quarter 2015 Conference Call and Webcast. Leading our call today will be Mike Jackson, Chairman, CEO and President; Cheryl Scully, CFO; Bill Berman, COO; and Jon Ferrando, EVP responsible for M&A.  Following their remarks, we will open up the call for questions. Robert Quartaro and I will also be available by phone following the call to address any additional questions that you may have.
Before we begin, let me read our brief statement regarding forward-looking comments. Certain statements and information on this call may constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Federal Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Such forward-looking statements involve risks, which may cause the actual results or performance to differ materially from such forward-looking statements. Additional discussions of factors that could cause actual results to differ materially are contained in our press release issued earlier today and our SEC filings, including our most recent annual report on Form 10-K and subsequent quarterly reports on Form 10-Q and current reports on Form 8-K. Certain non-GAAP financial measures as defined under SEC rules will be discussed on this call. Reconciliations are provided in our press release and on our website located at investors.autonation.com.
And now I will turn the call over to AutoNation's Chairman, CEO and President, Mike Jackson.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Good morning, and thank you for joining us. Today, we reported record first quarter earnings per share from continuing operations of $0.97, a 29% increase as compared to adjusted EPS from continuing operations of $0.75 for the same period in the prior yea
componenttext:
Good morning, and thank you for joining us. Today, we reported record first quarter earnings per share from continuing operations of $0.97, a 29% increase as compared to adjusted EPS from continuing operations of $0.75 for the same period in the prior year. This is our 18th consecutive quarter of double-digit year-over-year growth in EPS from continuing operations.
First quarter 2015 revenue totaled $4.9 billion compared to $4.4 billion in the year ago period, an increase of 13%, driven by a stronger performance in all of our business sectors.
In the first quarter, AutoNation's retail new vehicle unit sales increased 10% or 9% on same-store basis.
AutoNation continued reforms during this recovery with an optimal brand and market mix and a disciplined cost structure. We continue to drive solid results across all our business sectors.
I'll now turn the call over to Chief Financial Officer, Cheryl Scully.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Mike, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. For the first quarter, we reported net income from continuing operations of $112 million or $0.97 per share versus adjusted net income of $91 million or $0.75 per share during the first quarter of 2
componenttext:
Thank you, Mike, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. For the first quarter, we reported net income from continuing operations of $112 million or $0.97 per share versus adjusted net income of $91 million or $0.75 per share during the first quarter of 2014, a 29% improvement on a per-share basis. There were no adjustments to net income in the first quarter of 2015. Adjustments in net income in prior periods are included in the reconciliations provided in our press release.
In the first quarter, revenue increased $581 million or 13% compared to the prior year, and gross profit improved $93 million or 13%. SG&A as a percentage of gross profit was 69.7% for the quarter, which represents 110 basis point decrease compared to the year ago period.
Net new vehicle floorplan was a benefit of $14.2 million, an increase of $2.9 million from the first quarter of 2014, primarily due to higher floorplan assistance, which increased due to higher new vehicle sales.
Floorplan debt decreased sequentially, approximately $95 million, during the first quarter to $3 billion at quarter end, primarily due to increased -- decreased borrowings on our used vehicle floorplan facilities.
Nonvehicle interest expense decreased slightly to $21.4 million compared to $21.6 million in the first quarter of 2014, primarily due to improved pricing from our credit facility refinancing that was completed in December of 2014. At the end of March, we had $1 billion of outstanding borrowings under the revolving credit facility and a total nonvehicle debt balance of $2.1 billion. This was a decrease of $73 million compared to December 31, 2014. The provision for income tax in the quarter was $69.8 million or 38.5%.
From January 1 through April 20, 2015, we repurchased 150,000 shares for $9 million at an average price of $60.46 per share. AutoNation has approximately $272 million of remaining board authorization for share repurchase. As of April 20, there were approximately 114 million shares outstanding. This does not include the dilutive impact of stock options.
Our leverage ratio decreased to 2.2x at the end of Q1 as compared to 2.3x at the end of Q4. The leverage ratio was 2.0x on a net-debt basis, and this includes used floorplan availability. And our covenant limit is 3.75x.
Capital expenditures were $63 million for the quarter. Capital expenditures are on an accrual basis, excluding operating lease buyouts and related asset sales.
Our quarter-end cash balance was $74 million, which, combined with our additional borrowing capacity, resulted in total liquidity of $900 million at the end of March.
The finance team remains committed to supporting our operational partners with a unified focus on driving long-term shareholder value.
Now let me turn you over to our Chief Operating Officer, Bill Berman.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Cheryl, and good morning. AutoNation posted stellar first quarter results with double-digit growth in revenue and gross profit across all business sectors. This marked our 18th consecutive quarter of double-digit EPS growth. Going forward, my c
componenttext:
Thank you, Cheryl, and good morning. AutoNation posted stellar first quarter results with double-digit growth in revenue and gross profit across all business sectors. This marked our 18th consecutive quarter of double-digit EPS growth. Going forward, my comments will be on a same-store basis and compared to the period a year ago unless noted otherwise.
Total gross profit for variable operations was $459 million, up 12%. Total variable growth was $3,406 on a per vehicle retail basis, an increase of $67 or 2%. New and used same-store sale unit volume was up 10%. New vehicle revenue for the quarter was $2.7 billion, an increase of $277 million or 11%.
We retailed 76,900 units, an increase of 9%. New vehicle gross profit was $2,005 on a per vehicle retail basis, off slightly due to continued pressure in Import segment as well as growth in volume of entry-level Premium Luxury models.
For the quarter, used vehicle retail revenue was $1.1 billion, an increase of $121 million or 13%. Used vehicle retailed were 57,400, up 11%. Used vehicle gross profit was $1,738 on a per vehicle retail basis, a decrease of $42 or 2%.
As you might remember in Q1 2014, we focused on maximizing margins due to our tight inventory supply. We are well positioned with our used inventory for the second quarter. We increased our total store used units by 26% compared to last year and our current total store used vehicle inventory levels at 34 days.
Customer financial services gross profit set an all-time record at $1,515 on a per vehicle retail basis, an increase of $114 or 8%. Approximately 2/3 of our gross profit per vehicle retailed was related to customer financial service products, and approximately 1/3 was related to finance.
Total gross profit per customer financial services of $203 million was up $32 million or 19% compared to the period a year ago. We continue to see opportunity in customer financial services as we guard store-level execution and offer products that build customer value and loyalty.
In the quarter, customer care revenue was $723 million, an increase of $56 million or 8%. We've set an all-time record high in customer care gross profit of $310 million, an increase of $26 million or 9%.
Customer pay gross was $124 million, up 4%. This was our 19th consecutive quarterly increase in customer pay gross.
Warranty gross was $60 million, up 19%. Collision gross was $29 million, up 11%.
Excluding the impact of elevated recalls, we continue to expect mid-single-digit growth in customer care.
I would like to thank all 24,500 associates for a job well done this quarter. As an organization, we remain focused on driving sales, driving service and building the AutoNation brand.
I'll now turn the call over to Jon Ferrando.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Bill. We are excited to announce that in April, we completed 2 acquisitions that we signed in the first quarter, including Mercedes-Benz store located in San Jose, California. This represents our 22nd Mercedes-Benz franchise and our 21st franch
componenttext:
Thank you, Bill. We are excited to announce that in April, we completed 2 acquisitions that we signed in the first quarter, including Mercedes-Benz store located in San Jose, California. This represents our 22nd Mercedes-Benz franchise and our 21st franchise in Northern California.
We also acquired a Chrysler Dodge Jeep Ram store in Valencia, California, our 32nd franchise in Southern California. The Chrysler store will be an excellent addition to our business in the Valencia Auto Mall where we offer 9 brands.
AutoNation has also signed an agreement to acquire a Jaguar, Land Rover and Volvo store in our Spokane, Washington market. This will give us 25 franchises in the state of Washington.
As previously announced, during the quarter, we completed the acquisition of a Mercedes-Benz store in Reno, Nevada and a Volkswagen store in Atlanta. The combined annual revenue for our 5 acquisitions since the beginning of 2015, including the Spokane acquisition, which we expect to complete in early May, is approximately $320 million.
As of today, our store portfolio number is 290 franchises and 235 stores in 15 states, representing 34 manufacturer brands.
Looking forward, we will continue to actively pursue acquisitions and new store opportunities with a focus on enhancing brand representation within our auto retail markets as well as markets that can be supported by our existing management infrastructure.
As for M&A market conditions, there is a solid pipeline of potential opportunities in the marketplace. While we have not seen a material increase in competition for deals, we have seen an uptick in sellers testing the market with unrealistic expectations.
We will continue to be selective and prudent with our capital with a focus on investing to produce strong returns and long-term shareholder value.
I will now turn it back to Mike Jackson.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jon. We believe the auto industry is healthy. We still expect the industry new vehicle sales to be above 17 million units.And with that, we will take your questions.
componenttext:
Thanks, Jon. We believe the auto industry is healthy. We still expect the industry new vehicle sales to be above 17 million units.
And with that, we will take your questions.

headline: AutoNation Inc., Q1 2015 Earnings Call, Apr 22, 2015
